headline.main: VOYAGE OF THE ATLANTIC.; Narrative of John La Mountain. Aeronautic Perils, Privations and Hairbreadth Escapes.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Troy Daily Times. I started from Watertown to make a short, or "local" ascension, on the afternoon of Thursday, the 22d of September, at twenty-seven minutes before 6 o'clock.

headline.main: SUICIDE OF A NEW-YORK MERCHANT.; Charles M. Leupp, the Leather Dealer--Destroys Himself in a Fit of Insanity--The Coroner's Inquest.

docs.lead_paragraph: The community was yesterday profoundly shocked at the announcement of the self-inflicted death of Mr. CHARLES MORTIMER LEUPP, for many years well known as a prominent leather merchant. The deplorable event occurred on Wednesday evening, at the residence of the deceased, No. 23 Madisonavenue.

headline.main: THE PERILS OF AERIAL NAVIGATION.; Last Voyage of the Great Balloon "Atlantic." Interesting Narrative by Mr. Haddock.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly every one in this locality is aware that the second ascension of the Atlantic was advertised for the 20th of September. The storm of that and the following day obliged the postponement of the as cension until the 22d (Thursday.) Every arrangement had bean made for a successful inflation, and a thirty-seven minutes before 6 P. M. the glad words "All aboard," were heard from Mr. LA MOUNTAIN,

headline.main: OUR RELIGIOUS SOCIETIES.; Annual Meeting at Broome-street Church--Organization--Reports of the Treasurer and of the Managers--Proceedings and Addresses. AMERICAN BIBLE UNION.

docs.lead_paragraph: AMERICAN BIBLE UNION. Annual Meeting at Broome street Church--Organization--Reports of the Treasurer and of the Managers--Proceedings and Address. The Tenth Annual Meeting of the American Bible Union, a well-known association, which has for its aim the preparation and diffusion of a revised translation of the scriptures, was commenced yesterday morning in the church, corner of Elizabeth and Broome streets.

docs.snippet: Maj. R. S. Neighbors, Superintendent of Indian Affairs in Texas, was murdered in the town of Belknap, in that State, Sept. 14, by an unknown man, who stepped towards him in the street and shot him, and then fled. Maj. Neighbors had gone to Belknap to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Maj. R. S. Neighbors, Superintendent of Indian Affairs in Texas, was murdered in the town of Belknap, in that State, Sept. 14, by an unknown man, who stepped towards him in the street and shot him, and then fled. Maj. Neighbors had gone to Belknap to examine into the cause of some troubles with the Indians, and it is supposed that private revenge for some fancied injury prompted the act of his murderer.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; GENERAL AND COMMERCIAL NEWS. CHAMPION PRIZE FIGHT IN ENGLAND. ARRIVAL OF THE HUNGARIAN. Tile Inquest in Regard to the Great Eastern.

docs.lead_paragraph: The screw-steamship Hungarian, from Liver pool at 1 o'clock on the afternoon of the 21st ult., passed this point at about 3 o'clock this morning, and her mails and passengers will be due at Quebec at a late hour to-night. The steamship Fulton was appointed to leave Southampton the same afternoon for New-York.
